title: Purpose and objectives
body_md:
This policy sets out how {{firm.name}} applies the Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR) to strengthen accountability, conduct, and governance across the firm. It defines how responsibilities are allocated, how oversight is exercised, and how the firm evidences reasonable steps in the delivery of its regulated activities.

The objectives are to allocate clear accountability through Statements of Responsibilities, maintain an up-to-date responsibility map, ensure certification staff are assessed as fit and proper at least annually, embed the Conduct Rules across all relevant staff, and maintain evidence and governance that demonstrate compliance with FCA expectations.

title: Scope and applicability
body_md:
This policy applies to all UK regulated activities carried on by {{firm.name}} and to all staff who fall within SMCR scope, including Senior Managers, Certification Staff, and Conduct Rules Staff. It also applies to directors, secondees, contractors, and temporary staff where they perform roles in scope or have influence over regulated activities.

Where {{firm.name}} operates multiple legal entities or business lines, this policy applies to each entity in scope and is supported by entity-specific Statements of Responsibilities, responsibility maps, and governance arrangements.

title: SMCR roles and scope
body_md:
SMCR divides the firm into three populations: Senior Managers who hold FCA-approved SMF roles and carry prescribed responsibilities; Certification Staff who are assessed by {{firm.name}} as fit and proper because they can cause significant harm; and Conduct Rules Staff who are subject to the FCA Conduct Rules.

Role allocation follows the firm’s approved role catalogue and responsibility map. Senior Managers must have a clear allocation of responsibilities with no material gaps or overlaps, and any changes to role scope are assessed and documented before implementation.

title: Statements of Responsibilities and reasonable steps
body_md:
Each Senior Manager must have a clear, current Statement of Responsibilities (SoR) that describes their role, accountabilities, and prescribed responsibilities. SoRs are reviewed on appointment, on any material change, and at least annually, and are kept in a controlled register.

Reasonable steps evidence includes governance structures, delegated authorities, decision-making records, MI packs, challenge and escalation logs, handovers, and assurance activity. {{firm.name}} maintains these records to demonstrate that responsibilities are appropriately managed and risks are effectively controlled.

title: Duty of Responsibility
body_md:
Under the Duty of Responsibility, a Senior Manager may be held accountable if a regulatory breach occurs in their area and they did not take reasonable steps to prevent or stop it. The firm therefore expects Senior Managers to maintain effective oversight, ensure clear reporting lines, and act promptly on issues.

Where issues arise, Senior Managers must assess impact, implement remediation, and document decisions, including escalation to the Board or Compliance where required.

title: Certification regime
body_md:
{{firm.name}} maintains a certification regime for staff whose roles can cause significant harm. Certification assessments are completed at least annually and whenever a material change occurs to role, conduct, or competence.

Assessments consider honesty and integrity, competence and capability, and financial soundness. Evidence includes role profiles, training and competence records, performance reviews, disciplinary outcomes, and regulatory references where applicable. Certification decisions are recorded, and access to regulated activities is restricted where certification is not granted or is withdrawn.

title: COCON conduct rules
body_md:
The FCA Conduct Rules apply to all Conduct Rules Staff, with additional rules for Senior Managers. {{firm.name}} ensures that staff understand the standards of integrity, due skill and care, fair treatment of customers, and cooperation with regulators.

Breaches of the Conduct Rules are investigated promptly, assessed for regulatory impact, and reported to the FCA within required timeframes. Outcomes and remedial actions are recorded and used to inform training and performance management.

title: Non-financial misconduct
body_md:
Non-financial misconduct, such as bullying, harassment, discrimination, or dishonesty, can affect fitness and propriety and is assessed under the SMCR framework. {{firm.name}} treats such matters as potentially relevant to certification decisions and Senior Manager accountability.

Cases are assessed jointly by HR and Compliance, with outcomes documented and escalated where regulatory notification is required.

title: Regulatory references
body_md:
Regulatory references are obtained for Senior Managers and Certification Staff in line with FCA requirements. {{firm.name}} requests and provides references within required timeframes and ensures that references are considered as part of fit and proper assessments.

Records of requests, responses, and decisions are retained and used to support certification and appointment decisions.

title: Records and evidence
body_md:
{{firm.name}} maintains comprehensive SMCR records, including Statements of Responsibilities, responsibility maps, certification assessments, conduct rule training, breach investigations, disciplinary outcomes, and regulatory notifications. Records are maintained in controlled systems with appropriate access restrictions.

Retention periods follow FCA and legal requirements, and records are available for audit and supervisory review.

title: Training and awareness
body_md:
All staff in scope receive SMCR and Conduct Rules training at induction and on a regular refresher cycle. Senior Managers and Certification Staff receive role-specific training that reflects their responsibilities and regulatory obligations.

Completion, attestations, and outcomes are recorded and monitored by Compliance, with remedial training delivered where gaps are identified.

title: Governance and review
body_md:
Overall ownership of SMCR sits with an accountable Senior Manager, supported by Compliance and HR. MI is reported to senior management on matters such as certification status, conduct rule breaches, training completion, and regulatory reporting.

The policy is reviewed at least annually, and sooner where regulatory change, organisational change, or incidents indicate the need for update. Updates are approved through the firm’s governance process and communicated to affected staff.
